title: 107_hr3285
content: The "Federal-Local Information Sharing Partnership Act of 2001" allows for the sharing of grand jury information with law enforcement personnel of states or political subdivisions. The Act amends Rule 6(e)(3)(C) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure to specify guidelines for the use of shared information by state officials. SEC. 3 amends Section 2517(6) of title 18, United States Code to allow sharing of interception information with state law enforcement personnel. State officials must use the information in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General. SEC. 4 amends the USA PATRIOT ACT to allow sharing of foreign intelligence information with state law enforcement personnel, who must use the information in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General. SEC. 5 amends the Fair Credit Reporting Act to allow disclosure of consumer reports to law enforcement personnel for counterterrorism purposes, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General for confidentiality protection. Section 222(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allow the Secretary of State to provide records related to visas or permits to law enforcement personnel of a State if deemed necessary. The Secretary of State can provide visa or permit records to State law enforcement personnel if necessary, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 7 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquired from electronic surveillance. SEC. 8 also includes state law enforcement personnel in information acquired from physical searches. SEC. 9 addresses the disclosure of educational records. SEC. 9 amends the General Education Provisions Act to allow disclosure of educational records to law enforcement personnel for official duties. Any information received must be used in accordance with guidelines. SEC. 10 amends the National Education Statistics Act to allow disclosure of reports and records to law enforcement personnel of a State or political subdivision for official duties, with the requirement to use the information in accordance with guidelines.
